channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report X-2024040322
item.description:
Report X-2024040322

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic jugs in open bag inside oversized corrugated carton with paper filler. Loose cap on one jug allowed spillage which damaged carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2024040305
item.description:
Report X-2024040305

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damage was discovered in the unload. The unload manager called out to an Admin for assistance in containing the leakage. DescribePack: The jerrican cap/lid is either loose or defective since the leakage stems from the cap/lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The responding Admin contained the shipment in a hazardous materials spill tote and transported it to the hazmat cage for processing.

item.title: Report X-2024040259
item.description:
Report X-2024040259

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to the load side for a spill that happened in trailer and when QA arrived pkg. was leaking out all over ground inside trailer and it damaged a whole tire. DescribePack: Pkg. was loaded on its side and the closures came loose on 2 bottles and liquid leaked out soiling outer carton and inner bottles DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: trailer was taken to LC2 by QA and QA placed neutralizer on spill and red tagged trailer.

item.title: Report E-2024040140
item.description:
Report E-2024040140

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 15:38 PM ET, Darian Dietrich with UDV contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred on the dock in Henderson, CO. The spill consists of approximately 10 ounces that released from 2-1 gallon plastic jugs of Advanced Alcohol Gel Sanitizer (UN1993) , which were found leaking inside of the box they arrived in due to an unknown cause. No surfaces were impacted, only the box was dampened. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they placed the contents into a 10 gallon poly drum for disposal which was placed in the waste area for them to manage.
